reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located in a quiet little square off a semi-pedestrianised shopping street and close to the bay, busy night spots, restaurants and the historic centre. The staff were extremely helpful and very friendly. Our room was small but comfortable and continental breakfast was included. Very good value and an excellent location.
reviews.title: Great value & location.

reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel the night we arrived in Italy. They sent a taxi to meet us and he took us right to the hotel. I have to admit I would probably have missed it the first time walking by otherwise but that isn't a big problem, nor was the courtyard. The staff is wonderful and the hotel is interesting and perfectly located. We had a room overlooking the street which was great in the daytime, but unfortunately on a Saturday night is very noisy. If I were staying again (and I definitely would if in Naples again!), I would ask for something not on the street. There are hotels that are more luxurious, but not better located. It was perfect for the way we travel- We could walk everywhere! I would highly recommend!
reviews.title: great location, wonderful staff, good for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Quiet, on an inner courtyard away from Naples' noisy streets. Great location near Piazza del Plebiscito, Umberto Galleria, Teatro San Carlo, cafes, restaurants, street vendors. Friendly & knowledgeable staff--all of them fluent in English--ready to answer questions, make recommendations, call taxis. Clean, well-lit rooms tastefully decorated. Portrait of J.W. Goethe over fireplace. Excellent breakfasts, good service.
reviews.title: A clean, well-lighted place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night after being pampered in Capri, as we had to get an early flight. I was expecting alot more after reading the reviews. Took us a while to find it, walked past the archway twice. The room was overlooking the main street which was good as we like to people watch.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: The aircon was non existant, just made alot of noise and would not switch off, we had to flick the main fuse to shut it up. Tried to turn on the tiny tv but could just get sound so gave up. Bathroom was on a slant so when you had a shower you flooded the bedroom as the shower screen did not do it's job. There was a large hole in the bedroom wall !!! The bedding was clean.
reviews.title: Famous Napolitan Charm and Kindness

reviews.text: The hotel truly is charming but what makes it extra special is the staff. They promptly answered my many emails and were extremely helpful with all sorts of recommendations on arrival. Most importantly they arranged an excellent guide, Laura, to show us around Pompeii and Herculanuem for the day. This was one of the highlights of our trip.The hotel itself is very cute and overlooks a pedestrian street where there is always something to watch.( We stayed in Room 111) If you have lot of luggage like we did, don't fear, there is a lift to the first floor where the hotel is located and the hotel can arrange a taxi large enough to accomodate you all on the way back to the airport/train station at a very reasonable rate.All in all I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: a true hotel de"charm"

reviews.text: The location of the Chiaja Hotel cannot be beat. To start I always felt safe approaching or leaving this hotel at any hour of the day or night. It is situated on a side-street that is Pedestrian-only during the busy shopping hours, and within a short walk along or off Via Chiaja, one can find every possible kind of place to shop or dine. We even found a great place for manicures (called Beauty Care) around the corner. It was an easy walk to everything we wanted to see in Naples.
reviews.title: Great Value in Naples

reviews.text: The staff were absolutely excellent, offering helpful advice whenever we asked and suggesting lovely places to walk or dine. Breakfast was also excellent, and the afternoon pastry snacks were great-- and gave me the chance to try complimentary Baba a Rum and Sfoglietella at the hotel.
reviews.title: Overpriced, outdated, and misleading from reviews.

reviews.text: The room itself was small, perfectly clean but not well soundproofed. Our room lacked some "5 star" features -- the only mirror was at the bathroom sink and the water pressure in the tiny shower was weak- but these are things that are not so important. The price was very reasonable, making this a great value in Naples.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a good location, other than that the hotel is very poor. The walls are very dirty as if they haven't been painted in 5 years, there are Arabiian magazines from the 90's and the T.V doesn't get a solid reception. Bathrooms are nice and water pressure is awesome. I would suggest another place from the overall experience.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.text: This hotel made our trip to Naples extremely pleasant. The location is perfect for grabbing a taxi to anywhere (such as the museums) or walking through the old center. The famous cafe and arcade are right at the end of the street (which also boasts some good restaurants). The hotel was totally charming -- our room was lovely though simple in the old-fashioned European style with high ceilings, shuddered windows, etc. and it had a large and comfortable bathroom & tub. The staff members were very nice, helpful and friendly. The hotel promotes and participates in the Neapolitan cultural scene, e.g. hosting poetry readings in the lobby some afternoons, and the place has an intellectual/artsy feel. We loved Naples,which at this point is cleaner than New York City ! (though that's not saying much, admittedly ... ) The black stone streets are just awesome !! It is funky; in that it kind of reminds me of New York before it became fashionable, went yuppie, and was converted into a giant playpen for the super rich (boring). The Archeological Museum was fantastic, and the walk back (the long way) past the Duomo and through the old center on those black stone streets, stopping for lunch and at various churches, was thrilling and took my breath away. The food was also fantastic: best coffee, best pizza, best vongole (pasta smothered in delicious small clams), best baba rum I've ever tasted in my life. I'd love to go back, and I would definitely love to stay at Chiaja Hotel again.
reviews.title: Totally Charming

reviews.text: The hotel location was perfect. It was walking distance to great restaurants, shopping and the funicular. The staff was very friendly and helpful speaking good English. The room itself was quite small and kind of cramped, but comfortable.
reviews.title: Great location, helpful staff

reviews.text: Good atmosphere, fantastic location and excellent service. My husband and I had a great and at times amusing conversation with Flavio the night porter while finding out info for our onward journey.
reviews.title: Lovely stay

reviews.text: Okay! The bad news first. If you are not previously aware of where the hotel is located within the pedestrian walkway, you WILL have trouble locating it! There is only an old banner hanging on the wall of a building signifying that the hotel is behind a huge garage door. However, once you've located the hotel, everything is smooth sailing from there.
reviews.title: Location, location, location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Chiaja de Charme is located in the heart of the city in an upscale shopping plaza just down the street from the Palazzo Reale. There is a taxi stand just steps from the front door. The concierges are extremely helpful and knowledgeable about sites and events of the city. The front desk is manned 24 hours a day. You can also expect to receive a free breakfast every morning.
reviews.title: Noisy, noisy, noisy

reviews.text: Warm, family-run hotel with good-sized, stylish rooms in an excellent location near the piazza del plebiscito. I always feel welcome when I stay here.Near the main atractions:Galleria Umberto ,Maschio Angioino,Palazzo Reale,Via Toledo,shops,..metro station... if you like to walk (as we do), it will be a perfect choice.Nice places to eat nearby as well.Recomend and also return if visiting Naples again. The welcoming and attentive staff (particularly Annalisa). It is well-priced and popular, so book early or risk being shut out.
reviews.title: Weekend fantastic

reviews.text: This hotel is so good in Napoli because there are good location in the city. We can easy to sightseeing in there from the hotel. In addition, the staff is kindful, freindly and Hospetality. It's too comfortable to stay in there. We can be happy to stay in there. I think so very well. If you will confused where will you stay in Naples, you must choies to stay in there! graize!
reviews.title: Hospitality

reviews.text: Staff made us very welcome and were extremely helpful. The hotel was in a wonderful location, downstairs, through a courtyard and immediate access to shops. The waterfront was a short walk away and 3 km from central terminal. We would certainly stay there again
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.text: Tucked away in a courtyard on the first floor of a lovely building, this was a complete shot in the dark in terms if choice of hotel but turned out to be a great choice. Definitely the best area of Naples, ideal for the main sights. The room was relatively small but furnished with antiques. Bathroom was fine and very clean. What we liked best was the quiet, the charm and individuality. Breakfast was good (continental) and Federica on the desk was extremely helpful.
reviews.title: Unusual hotel..... great find.

reviews.text: The hotel is well located, the staff is pleasant, the rooms are pretty clean. And the living room lobby is a cozy place. All these make for a pleasant stay. But the rooms are very basic ---- the tile floors are totally bare, there are no amenities in the bathrooms (soaps, cups, place for cups), some of the bathrooms are of the type where there is no lip in the shower so one must learn to squeegee the water toward the drain. And some of the rooms are totally interior, so that there is no signal for either wifi or cell phone.
reviews.title: Convenient, pleasant hotel, but on the basic side
